author: Coral Barry
title: Bastian Schweinsteiger did not get the chance to say goodbye to Manchester United team-mates
text:
Bastian Schweinsteiger played just under two seasons at Manchester United (Picture: Getty) Bastian Schweinsteiger was not able to say his farewells to his Manchester United team-mates because he did not want to distract them from their upcoming game.
Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future The German arrived in Chicago this week to complete his move to the MLS after United released him from his contract at the club.
Schweinsteiger was hardly playing at United, but was still a greatly loved figure among supporters and in the first-team.
But with United playing a game on Sunday on the week Schweinsteiger decided to leave, the midfielder did not want to distract his team-mates with teary goodbyes.
‘It was not so easy because the decision was a bit late so I couldn’t say a proper goodbye to the team,’ Schweinsteiger said
Schweinsteiger was unveiled as a Chicago Fire player on Wednesday (Picture: Getty) ‘Also they had a match away against – I can’t remember – but they had a match on Sunday so I couldn’t really tell them because I didn’t want the focus on me, I wanted to have the focus on the team and the game. So I was very happy that they won.

‘I had a great time there, especially with the team-mates and the staff there, it was a good time and I enjoyed it there.’
Chicago Fire fans gave Schweinsteiger a hero’s welcome at the airport as the 32-year-old officially became a MLS player.
The American side are just the third club Schweinsteiger will play for in a long career that includes a World Cup with Germany.
